tit.e: Miroku-ishi Stone (a stone dedicated in hokora [a small shrine] near the entrance to Oku no in [inner sanctuary] of Mt. Koya)
Miroku-ishi Stone (a stone dedicated in hokora [a small shrine] near the entrance to Oku no in [inner sanctuary] of Mt. Koya)

sen.j: 弥勒石（みろくいし）とは、和歌山県の霊場高野山の奥の院入り口付近にある祠に納められた石。
sen.e: Miroku-ishi Stone is the stone placed in hokora (a small shrine) near the entrance to Oku no in (inner sanctuary) of Koya-san Mountain, the sacred ground of Wakayama Prefecture.
Miroku-ishi Stone is the stone placed in hokora near the entrance to Oku no in of Mt. Koya, the sacred ground of Wakayama Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 前出用語補足を削除しました。
sen.e: Miroku-ishi Stone is the stone placed in hokora near the entrance to Oku no in of Mt. Koya, the sacred ground of Wakayama Prefecture.

sen.j: 触れると弥勒菩薩の御利益があるという。
sen.e: It is said that, if one touches this stone, they will receive blessings of Miroko Bosatsu (Buddha of the Future, Bodhisattva of the Present).
It is said that, if one touches this stone, he or she will receive blessings of Miroku Bosatsu (Buddha of the Future, Bodhisattva of the Present).
sen.cmt: スペル修正、統一リストに合わせました。
sen.e: It is said that, if one touches this stone, he or she will receive blessings of Miroku Bosatsu (Buddha of the Future, Bodhisattva of the Present).

sen.j: なお、この名をつけた饅頭がみやげとして売られている。
sen.e: Buns stuffed with azuki-bean paste named after Miroku-ishi Stone are being sold as souvenir.

sen.e: It is a stone statue in Asuka-mura, Nara Prefecture.

sen.j: 条里制の標石であったらしいが定かでない。
sen.e: It seems to have been a stone marker under Jorisei (system of land subdivision in ancient Japan) but is now known.
